\vskip 1.5cm

\begin{center} {\bf ABSTRACT } \end{center}
%\vspace{-2mm}

\noindent 
We study the heterotic string compactified on $K3 \times T^2$
near the line $T=U$, where the effective action becomes
singular due to an $SU(2)$ gauge symmetry enhancement.  
By `integrating in' the light
$W^\pm$ vector multiplets we derive a quantum corrected effective
action which is manifestly $SU(2)$ invariant and non-singular.
This effective action is  
found to be consistent with a residual $SL(2,\mathbf{Z})$
quantum symmetry  on the line $T=U$.
In an appropriate decompactification limit, we recover the known $SU(2)$ 
invariant action in five dimensions.\\


\vfill January 2003

\
